follow_up.question: Which type of support would help most right now?

option_tips.Still in a relationship: Keep this plan updated, and remember you can always reach out if things escalate.
option_tips.Planning to leave: Start packing small items now so you're ready when you decide to leave.
option_tips.Post-separation: It's normal to feel unsettled, refer back to this plan whenever you need a safety reminder.

city.general_tip: Save the local support numbers for {city} in your phone's speed-dial so you can call immediately if you need help.

safe_room.general_tip: Keep your essentials (phone, keys, and a small flashlight) in {safe_room} so you can grab them instantly when you need to leave.

option_tips.Family: Let those you live with: {living_situation} know your safe room and cue-word so they can support you in an emergency.
option_tips.Roommates: Let those you live with: {living_situation} know your safe room and cue-word so they can support you in an emergency.
option_tips.Alone: Since you live alone, identify a trusted neighbor or friend and share your safe room location with them.
option_tips.Partner: Because you live with your partner, keep your safety plan hidden (in {safe_room}), and consider storing a digital copy in a password-protected note they won't see.

option_tips.Yes: Practice your safety plan with your children so that when they hear {code_word}, they know exactly what to do.
option_tips.No: Even without children, it helps to identify a second safe space in your home.

abuse_types.general_tip: If you face {abuse_types} abuse, remember you don't have to face it alone. Reach out to your emergency contact right away.

option_tips.Yes: Log each incident (date, time, and a brief note) so you have clear records if needed later.
option_tips.No: Even brief notes on your phone can be helpful. Start logging today.

emergency_contact.general_tip: Save {emergency_contact} in your phone under a code-word so you can quietly call them when you need help.

leave_timing.general_tip: Set a real target {leave_timing} and pack one essential item each day until you're ready.

option_tips.Yes: Great! Keep your go-bag in a hidden spot so you can grab it quickly.
option_tips.No: Pack a simple go-bag today with essentials like your ID, some cash, and a charger.

money_location.general_tip: Stash some cash and a spare card in {money_location}, a spot your partner won't suspect.

option_tips.Yes: Make sure {temp_shelter} knows you may arrive unexpectedly and how to contact you.
option_tips.No: Reach out to Victim Services Toronto or a trusted friend now to secure a shelter option before you leave.

option_tips.Yes: Since you've heard from them, stay vigilant and keep your protection order handy if you have one.
option_tips.No: Even without contact, keep your doors locked and your phone on in case you need to call 911.

option_tips.Yes: Carry your {legal_order} at all times and share copies with anyone who needs to know.
option_tips.No: Consider applying for a protection order; it can help deter unwanted contact.

option_tips.Yes: Make sure your {equipment} is in working order and placed where you'll notice it.
option_tips.No: Consider installing a simple door alarm or camera to alert you to unexpected entry.

support_choice.general_tip: Reach out to {support_choice} - they can offer the specialized help you need right now.
